description: Critical privilege escalation vulnerability in Intel Active Management Technology (AMT), Intel Standard Manageability (ISM), and Intel Small Business Technology. Allows unprivileged network attackers to gain control of the manageability features provided by these products. This includes system provisioning, remote power control, and keyboard-video-mouse control. Also known as 'Silent Bob is Silent' or INTEL-SA-00075.
remediation: Update Intel ME firmware to version 11.0.55, 11.5.55, 11.6.55, 11.7.55, 11.10.55, 11.20.55 or later. Disable AMT if not required. Check with OEM for updated system firmware containing patched ME.

description: Speculative execution side channel vulnerability in Intel Management Engine (ME) firmware. Allows authenticated users to potentially enable information disclosure via local access to ME subsystem. Part of the Spectre family of vulnerabilities affecting Intel processors and firmware.
remediation: Update Intel ME firmware to versions specified in INTEL-SA-00125. Apply microcode updates and BIOS updates from system manufacturer.

component: Intel Converged Security and Management Engine (CSME)
description: Improper input validation in Intel CSME before versions 12.0.70, 13.0.40, 14.0.45 may allow an unauthenticated user to potentially enable escalation of privilege via physical access. Affects Intel CSME, Intel SPS, Intel TXE.
remediation: Update to Intel CSME firmware version 12.0.70, 13.0.40, 14.0.45 or later as specified in INTEL-SA-00295. Contact OEM for system firmware updates.

component: Intel Converged Security and Management Engine (CSME)
description: Improper access control in the firmware for Intel CSME before versions 14.0.47, 14.5.32, 15.0.22 may allow a privileged user to potentially enable escalation of privilege via local access. INTEL-SA-00459.
remediation: Update Intel CSME firmware to version 14.0.47, 14.5.32, 15.0.22 or later. Apply system BIOS/firmware updates from OEM.

component: Intel Converged Security and Management Engine (CSME)
description: Insufficient control flow management in firmware for Intel CSME before versions 15.0.30 and 16.0.15 may allow a privileged user to potentially enable escalation of privilege via local access.
remediation: Update to Intel CSME firmware version 15.0.30, 16.0.15 or later as specified in INTEL-SA-00528.

description: Hardware debug exception vulnerability affecting AMD PSP firmware. Improper handling of debug exceptions before microcode initialization may allow local attackers to gain elevated privileges. Affects multiple AMD processor families.
remediation: Update AMD PSP firmware through BIOS/UEFI updates provided by system manufacturer. Ensure latest AGESA updates are applied.

description: Security vulnerability in AMD Secure Processor (PSP) may allow an attacker with local administrative privileges to execute arbitrary code within the PSP secure execution environment. Affects AMD EPYC and Ryzen processors.
remediation: Apply BIOS updates containing PSP firmware updates from system OEM. Update to AGESA 1.0.0.3 or later versions.

description: Improper validation of software-generated addresses in AMD PSP may allow unauthorized access to secure memory regions. Affects AMD EPYC and Ryzen PRO processors with PSP.
remediation: Update to PSP firmware versions specified in AMD security bulletin. Apply latest BIOS/UEFI updates from OEM containing updated AGESA.

description: Critical Secure Boot security feature bypass vulnerability (BlackLotus). Allows attackers to bypass UEFI Secure Boot protections and install persistent bootkit malware that survives OS reinstalls. Affects Windows Boot Manager signed before specific dates.
remediation: Apply Windows updates KB5012170, KB5012124, KB5012117. Update UEFI firmware to latest version with revoked bootloaders in DBX. Add compromised certificates to Secure Boot forbidden list.

description: Buffer overflow in GRUB2 bootloader (BootHole). Allows attackers to bypass UEFI Secure Boot and execute arbitrary code during boot. Affects virtually all Linux distributions using GRUB2 with Secure Boot.
remediation: Update GRUB2 to version 2.04 or later with BootHole patches. Update UEFI firmware DBX to revoke vulnerable GRUB2 signatures. May require reinstalling bootloader and updating Secure Boot certificates.

description: Out-of-bounds write in GRUB2's JPEG image handling code. Allows attackers to bypass Secure Boot and execute arbitrary code. Part of BootHole 2 vulnerability set.
remediation: Update GRUB2 to version 2.06 with security patches. Apply UEFI firmware updates with revoked GRUB2 signatures in DBX.

description: Memory corruption vulnerability in UEFI firmware implementations. Improper validation of system management mode (SMM) handlers may allow privilege escalation and persistent firmware implants.
remediation: Update system BIOS/UEFI firmware to latest version from OEM. Enable BIOS write protection and Intel Boot Guard where available.

description: Intel Boot Guard ACM revocation bypass vulnerability. Insufficient verification of Authenticated Code Modules may allow attackers to bypass Boot Guard protections and execute unsigned firmware.
remediation: Update Intel ME/CSME firmware through system BIOS updates. Update Boot Guard ACMs to revoked versions list. Verify Boot Guard policy enforcement.

description: Intel TXT authentication bypass vulnerability. Improper implementation of Authenticated Code Module (ACM) verification may allow local attackers to bypass TXT security features.
remediation: Update system firmware with latest Intel TXT ACM modules. Apply BIOS updates from OEM containing Intel microcode and ACM updates.

component: Intel Converged Security and Management Engine (CSME)
description: Insufficient access control in Intel CSME subsystem firmware may allow privileged users to enable information disclosure via local access.
remediation: Update Intel CSME firmware to versions specified in INTEL-SA-00213. Apply system firmware updates from OEM.

component: Intel Converged Security and Management Engine (CSME)
description: Race condition in Intel CSME firmware may allow privileged users to potentially enable denial of service via local access.
remediation: Update to Intel CSME firmware versions specified in INTEL-SA-00391. Contact system manufacturer for firmware updates.

component: Intel Converged Security and Management Engine (CSME)
description: Hardware allows activation of test or debug logic at runtime for some Intel processors. May allow an unauthenticated user to potentially enable escalation of privilege via physical access.
remediation: Update Intel CSME firmware to versions 11.8.90, 11.12.90, 11.22.90, 12.0.81, 13.0.47, 13.30.17, 14.1.53, 14.5.32, 15.0.22. Apply BIOS updates from OEM.

description: Improper bounds checking in ASP firmware may allow an attacker to issue a system call from a compromised ABL or BIOS that may cause out-of-bounds memory accesses.
remediation: Update AMD PSP firmware through BIOS updates from system OEM. Apply latest AGESA firmware containing security fixes.

description: Insufficient DRAM address validation in AMD Secure Processor (PSP) may allow an attacker to access sensitive information within the ASP potentially leading to a loss of integrity, availability, and confidentiality.
remediation: Update AMD PSP firmware to latest version through system BIOS updates. Apply AGESA updates from motherboard manufacturer.

description: Improper access control in AMD Secure Processor (PSP) may allow an attacker with a malicious BIOS to access sensitive information potentially leading to information disclosure and code execution.
remediation: Update system BIOS containing latest AMD PSP firmware. Verify BIOS integrity and enable Secure Boot.

description: Security feature bypass in UEFI Secure Boot. Additional bootloader vulnerabilities requiring DBX updates to revoke compromised certificates and prevent bootkit installations.
remediation: Apply Windows updates containing updated Secure Boot DBX. Update UEFI firmware to include latest certificate revocation list.
